section.title: Example file
section.para: The file should contain something like this:
section.programlisting: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?> <component type="addon"> <id>gedit-bookmarks</id> <extends>gedit.desktop</extends> <name>Bookmarks</name> <summary>Easy document navigation with bookmarks</summary> <url type="homepage">https://wiki.gnome.org/Apps/Gedit/ShippedPlugins</url> <url type="bugtracker">https://bugzilla.gnome.org/enter_bug.cgi?product=gedit&component=Plugins</url> <metadata_license>CC0-1.0</metadata_license> <project_license>GPL-2.0+</project_license> </component>

section.title: Metadata file contents
section.para: This is a list of tags you might want to define for your application. For a full list of possible tags, take a look at the definition of a generic component () and an addon-component ().

listitem.para: For addons, there are no special requirements for what their <id/> should be.

note.para: Highly recommended to use format: application_name-plugin_name

listitem.para: This tag is refers to the .desktop file of the component this addon is extending.
This tag is described in detail for addon components at .
For addons, there are no special requirements for what their <name/> should be.

note.para: Don't put the application name you are extending in the <name/> - so you want to use Bookmarks rather than GEdit Bookmarks

listitem.para: For addons, there are no special requirements for what their <summary/> should be.

note.para: Don't put the application name you are extending in the <summary/> - so you want to use Easy document navigation with bookmarks rather than Easy document navigation with bookmarks in GEdit
Don't use long or short descriptions. Ideally <summmary/> should be less than 101 and more than 8.

listitem.para: This is a recommended tag for links of types homepage and bugtracker.
Links of type homepage should be a link to the upstream homepage for the addon.

Links of type bugtracker should be a link to the upstream bugtracker.
Highly recommended to be a link to the upstream bugzilla with filed component and product.

note.para: You can omit the <url/> if it's the same as the upstream project.
Highly recommended to escape URLs. For example:

listitem.para: For other possible values, tage a look at the tag's description in .

The <metadata_license/> tag is indicating the content licence that you are releasing the one AppData text file as. This is not typically the same as the project licence. By ommitting the licence value would probably mean your data would not be incorporated into the distribution metadata.
The licence codes correspond to the identifiers found at the SPDX OpenSource License Registry. Take a look at for more details about this tag.
The <project_license/> tag is indicating the licenses that you used for the application and any data or media files used. This is not typically the same as the metadata license.
The licence codes correspond to the identifiers found at the SPDX OpenSource License Registry.
There are no special requirements for what their <updatecontant/> should be. This tag is not required.

note.para: Highly recommended to use this tag. If you include the <updatecontact/> tag then someone will send an email when the standard is updated, detailing the new fields that you may or may not want to add to your file.
If public mailing list without registration is available for project with this addon - use it's email.
